results.title: Baby girl
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chrissy Ponting
results.brief_description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.
results.description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.

results.title: Baby crazy
results.brief_description: Being a parent is one of humanity’s most demanding and rewarding experiences - a mixture of infatuation, mad passion, fear, fun, guilt and enduring love. This amusing documentary looks at four young couples who share their intimate experiences of parenting by providing privileged access to rare moments on home video recordings and interviews. It’s a fascinating story of how a family grows and changes. “Baby Crazy” is narrated by well known actress Noni Hazelhurst, and is almost required viewing for soon to be parents, baby watchers, and baby lovers. It shows all the sensual, tender, crazy and fun-filled aspects of babyhood along with the pain and not so fun-filled aspects of having a child. Inspired by the book “Baby Crazy” by Helen Townsend.

results.title: Baby care: feeding
results.creator_credit: Irving C. Boerlin, Pennsylvania State College Productions and Paul H Seilzinger
results.brief_description: The steps necessary when prepapring to feed an infant are dealt with in detail, with stress on the importance of cleanliness and exactness. (Deals mainly with artificial feeding).

results.title: Baby animals
results.brief_description: A number of simple scientific facts about baby animals are presented in such a way as to be suitable for children of kindergarten age, including: mother deer taking care of her young; pelicans from birth, skunk taking care of yer young; a baby racoon’s first trip to the river and an oppossum carrying its young up a tree.

results.title: Baby and the bottle
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock and Cambridge FIlm T V Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes and demonstrates the bottle feeding of a baby. It points out important details which must be observed to ensure satisfactory feeding and demonstrates preparation and sterilization methods, including terminal sterilization whereby several bottles can be prepared and stored for future use.

results.title: Baboons
results.brief_description: Part of a series called “Zoo animals in the wild”, this film shows the baboon travelling in troops, looking for food and caring for its young. Suitable for mid-upper Primary school. No other credits available.

results.title: Baboon social organization
results.creator_credit: C. Cameron Macauley and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Baboon Social Life”.
Analyses the nature of the interdependence within a baboon troop and its close relation to baboon ecology. Discusses the role of central males, peripheral males, mothers with infants and juveniles. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Baboon development: the older infant, four months to one year (Nairobi Park)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, National Science Foundation, Ford Foundation and Educational Services
results.brief_description: Part of a series of films on the baboons of Kenya. Shows without commentary or narration, the growth and development of a baby baboon over one year of its life.
